content.description: A short, fun sport route that requires good footwork. Has some cool pockets and a mantel move. Not as good as it's neighbor, Classic Crack, but worth doing if you're in the area.
content.protection:
Bruce Morris Guide shows two bolts, but there's actually three. Optional finger sized gear in a flak between the second and third bolt. Two bolt anchor with rap rings that have seen better days.

Possible to forth class up to the anchors a little lower down in the gully.
content.location: South East side of Eagle Peak just to the left of Classic Crack. Pick up Rock Climbing Guide to the Castle Rock Area for a slightly detailed approach description.

content.description: A thin crack on a slab leads to a slightly overhung face covered in knobs and pockets.
content.protection: 3 or 4 bolts to a 3 bolt anchor.
content.location: The very first route as you go down the gulley. TR can be set up from the top of the rock, without going down the gulley.

content.description: This is a great climb, with consistent and fun difficulty. Definitely do this if you are in the area. Climb the obvious corner to the top.
content.location:
This is located on the southeastern shoulder of Eagle Peak. You can fourth class up the main slab of Eagle Peak to the anchors from a little lower down if you don't want to lead.

This climb is just to the right of another 5.9 with 2 bolts.
